All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Action
Action is a collection of commands which are used to determine the type of function to apply to an entity.
CalcController
Calculates the cost for all orders with the same reference
Calculator
Calculator object, takes in an order references and locates invalid input: '&' costs all orders with that reference
CalculatorTest
 
CoolStore
Takes user input and delegates to appropriate class to execute actions and access the database
CrudController<T>
Create, Read, Update and Delete controller.
Customer
Customer object, models SQL entity, includes constructors and getters invalid input: '&' setters, as well as hashcode, equals, and tostring overwrites
CustomerController
Takes in customer details for CRUD functionality
CustomerControllerTest
Uses Mockito to ensure that the CustomerController executes their CRUD commands through the use of the DAO classes, ensuring communication with the SQL database
CustomerDAO
 
CustomerDAOTest
Confirms that the data given in the test matches the data pulled from the database, ensuring the CustomerDAO accurately updates the database, and reads from it, rather than simply creating new objects
CustomerTest
Confirms proper overwriting of the hashcode and equals functions
Dao<T>
Persists changes to the SQL database
DBUtils
SQL Connection Utility - allows users to connect to the database by editing the db.properties file, as well as specifying commands to run
Domain
Domain is a collection of commands which are used to determine the domain to apply a function to
Item
Item object, models SQL entity, includes constructors and getters invalid input: '&' setters, as well as hashcode, equals, and tostring overwrites
ItemController
Takes in item details for CRUD functionality
ItemControllerTest
Uses Mockito to ensure that the ItemController executes their CRUD commands through the use of the DAO classes, ensuring communication with the SQL database
ItemDAO
 
ItemDAOTest
Confirms that the data given in the test matches the data pulled from the database, ensuring the ItemDAO accurately updates the database, and reads from it, rather than simply creating new objects
ItemTest
Confirms proper overwriting of the hashcode and equals functions
Main
MAIN CLASS Entry point for execution of project
Order
Order object, models SQL entity, includes constructors and getters invalid input: '&' setters, as well as hashcode, equals, and tostring overwrites
OrderController
Takes in order details for CRUD functionality
OrderControllerTest
Uses Mockito to ensure that the OrderController executes their CRUD commands through the use of the DAO classes, ensuring communication with the SQL database
OrderDAO
 
OrderDAOTest
Confirms that the data given in the test matches the data pulled from the database, ensuring the OrderDAO accurately updates the database, and reads from it, rather than simply creating new objects
OrderTest
Confirms proper overwriting of the hashcode and equals functions
Utils
Utils tool - accesses the scanner and converts user input to a Long, String, or Double to be called by other classes
